item.title: Controller
item.dc:creator: pa
item.content:encoded:
The successful Controller candidate will manage accounting, reporting, finance, budgeting and modeling functions, including billings, A/R, A/P and Payroll. Candidate will also evaluate, select and implement scalable systems to automate processes effectively and assist with contract administration. Reports directly to the CFO.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Ensure that company financial records and reports are maintained in compliance with company policies and US GAAP (accrual basis). Responsible for preparing monthly/quarterly draft financial statements, forecasts, account reconciliations and other documents to ensure this compliance.
  • Implement policies and procedures (internal controls) to provide reasonable assurance that the company assets are protected.
  • Evaluate, select and implement scalable systems to automate processes effectively.
  • Ensure only valid expenses with proper management authorization are paid.
  • Ensure that (i) contract terms evolve and are administered effectively in accordance with company policy (ii) credit risk and other negotiable terms are balanced with business objectives and (iii) progress toward targets are clearly communicated.
  • Responsible for proper timing and application of revenue recognition rules. Involves significant interaction with Sales and Customer Service groups.
  • Ensure the completion of Federal and State tax reporting requirements (including income, property, sales and use, payroll and other local taxes), insurance reports and other reports that may be required by government entities.
  • Coordinate work relating to external audits in the periodic review of the company financial records.
  • Responsible for the implementation of agreed upon recommendations, related to areas of responsibility, resulting from the audit findings.
  • Startup mentality! This is a fast-growing startup environment and the candidate must have a willingness to pitch-in when asked to support other areas.

Degree/Licenses

  • Undergraduate Degree in Accounting, CPA certification preferred.

Prior Experience

  • Minimum 5 years of accounting experience, with top-tier public accounting being a plus.
  • Demonstrated ability to plan and close books and prepare financial statements monthly
  • Experience analyzing business performance and developing financial plans within a startup environment desirable.
  • Understanding of US GAAP, internal controls and financial reporting required.

What We Offer

  • Competitive compensation package, including: salary, equity and merit-based bonuses
  • An exciting, fast-paced work environment focused on results
  • Comprehensive training, support tools, and structured work model
  • Opportunity to work alongside industry leaders
  • Chance to change the mobile industry and make mobile advertising better

About Us

Yieldmo is a rapidly growing mobile advertising tech startup based near Union Square in New York City. We are backed by blue chip investors, including Time Warner, Google Ventures, and Union Square Ventures. We have built a powerful platform that is reframing advertising for mobile. We believe in effective and delightful ways to deliver advertising on mobile devices (and we don’t like interruptive advertising.) Our tech allows for unique ways to execute on this promise. Our goal is to save the world from bad mobile ads. If interested apply by sending your resume to position1@yieldmo.com with "YOUR NAME - Yieldmo Controller" as the subject line.
item.excerpt:encoded: Reporting directly to the CFO, this person will manage financial organization, budgeting, control, forecasting, systems and process implementations. Salary commensurate with experience, plus bonus and stock options.

item.title: Front-end Designer
item.dc:creator: pa
item.content:encoded:
We own a complete end-to-end solution (from advertiser to publisher,) including unique ad formats, ad server, auction bidding, and optimization algorithms. We contract for exclusive placements on 100% of the pages of premium publishers like CNN, Reuters, Forbes, Rolling Stone, and many more. We then provide that inventory to advertisers and share revenue with the publishers. Our platform allows for an incomparable level of testing and optimization using machine learning and predictive analysis.

About the position

We are looking for an exceptional front-end designer for our Ad Format Lab. The Ad Format Lab is a group at Yieldmo focused on creating the most innovative ways to deliver ad content on mobile publisher pages. We are creating opportunities to improve the reading experience for mobile publishing with an eye towards scalability. Our team is a mix of Designers and Developers that strategically identify insights, create inspired prototypes, and continuously test these prototypes live in the market. We improve on our existing product offering, we develop promising concepts, and we identify entirely new formats and interactions that will help shape content delivery on the mobile web. Your role on the team would be to collaborate with other team members in strategy and concept generation. You would then own the process of moving from concept to visual prototypes. This involves creating sketches, user flows, rough mock-ups, and pixel perfect formats that developers on the team can build in code. We work at a fast pace and generally build out several concepts each week to test. Our platform lets us place our design experiments in front of millions of people every week, which lets us validate our design hypotheses. Our work is generative, iterative, and we learn by doing.

Responsibilities:

  • Work collaboratively with a growing team of Designers and Developers to identify promising product opportunities
  • Draft information architectures, user flows, and wireframes
  • Develop visual and interactive prototypes
  • Communicate design intent to Developers
  • Interpret feedback from our A/B testing to continuously improve our offering

Sensibilities:

  • You are optimistic and collaborative in helping shape a vision for our design direction
  • You are a self-starter and take ownership of your piece of the puzzle
  • You are curious about the state of Design and Technology, have a strong point of view about your work, and hold yourself to high standards
  • You are comfortable with ambiguity and help turn conversation into action
  • You are energized by the pace of a tech startup

Requirements:

  • A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree and 2-5 years experience working in digital Design
  • A strong portfolio of work demonstrating your experience in visual design and interaction design with motion design as a big plus
  • Comfort with the Adobe suite: specifically PS, AI, ID with Edge and AE as a plus
  • Some experience with consumer research
  • An understanding of HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript (though you are not expected to be a developer)

We Offer:

  • Competitive compensation including salary, equity, and merit-based bonuses
  • Health, Dental, Vision, and other insurance plans
  • An office dog and Rancilio espresso machine and a weekly lunch gathering
  • Opportunities to connect with others at our investors’ portfolio companies

About Yieldmo:

Yieldmo is a rapidly growing mobile advertising tech startup based near Union Square in New York City. We are backed by blue chip investors, including Time Warner, Google Ventures, and Union Square Ventures. We have built a powerful platform that is reframing advertising for mobile. We believe in effective and delightful ways to deliver advertising on mobile devices (and we don’t like interruptive advertising.) Our tech allows for unique ways to execute on this promise. Our goal is to save the world from bad mobile ads. If you're interested, please send cover letter, website/portfolio, and resume directly to David Goligorsky, david [at] yieldmo (dot) com.

item.title: Lead Graphic Designer
item.dc:creator: dgoligorsky
item.content:encoded:
Responsibilities:

  • Evolving the Yieldmo brand identity and owning brand communications, which includes demo videos, case studies, collateral for special events, and more.
  • Creating mock campaigns that show our advertising clients what’s possible on our platform.
  • Supporting our clients in delivering exceptional campaigns on our platform.
  • Collaborating with the Product Design team on special projects

Qualifications:

  • A BA/BS in Design (graphic, UI/UX, even industrial design) with a passion for communication design, MA/MS a plus
  • 2+ years experience in a Graphic Design role
  • A portfolio that shows depth in communications and breadth (e.g. print, digital, brand identity, marketing, animation, packaging, and so forth.)
  • Expertise in the Adobe Creative Suite, namely PS, AI, ID, and AE
  • Experience in a fast paced environment like a design firm, ad agency, startup, or freelancing
Current Yieldmo Designers come from backgrounds that include IDEO, Smart Design, IBM, and Milton Glaser’s studio. We are rigorous yet playful. Mature yet curious. It’s a flat organization where productive collaboration pairs with self-directed ownership.

Sensibilities:

  • You are optimistic and collaborative in helping shape a vision for our design direction
  • You are a self-starter and take ownership of your piece of the puzzle
  • You are curious about the state of Design and Technology, have a strong point of view about your work, and hold yourself to high standards
  • You are comfortable with ambiguity and help turn conversation into action
  • You are energized by the pace of a tech startup
About Yieldmo Yieldmo is a rapidly growing mobile advertising tech startup based near Union Square in New York City. We are backed by blue chip investors, including Time Warner, Google Ventures, and Union Square Ventures. We have built a powerful platform that is reframing advertising for mobile. We believe in effective and delightful ways to deliver advertising on mobile devices (and we don’t like interruptive advertising.) Our tech allows for unique ways to execute on this promise. Our goal is to save the world from bad mobile ads.

We offer:

  • Competitive compensation including salary, equity, and merit-based bonuses
  • Health, Dental, Vision, and other insurance plans
  • An office dog, Rancilio espresso machine, and Friday Lunch
  • Opportunities to connect with peers at our investors’ portfolio companies
If this sounds like a good fit to you, please send a portfolio (.pdf or URL) by email to David Goligorsky, Head of Design, at david [at] yieldmo [dot] com
item.excerpt:encoded:
We’re looking for a talented graphic designer to join the Design team full-time.
As Lead Graphic Designer at Yieldmo, you’ll be part of a rapidly growing team focused on defining the visual communication for our product and brand.

item.title: Senior Front-end Engineer
item.dc:creator: pa
item.content:encoded:
We are looking for a dynamic, design-oriented developer who can breathe innovation into our current and future ad formats, in turn creating more value for our advertisers and publishers alike. You should be comfortable in CSS, HTML, and JavaScript, and understand the benefits and pitfalls of each with respect to the mobile environment. Aside from the standard front-end skillset, you should also be passionate about learning new technologies as it pertains to the task at hand (i.e. learning fundamentals about how our back-end stack serves ads to the front-end). Yieldmo is a mobile advertising startup based near Union Square, right in the heart of New York City. Yieldmo's platform allows premium publishers to monetize their page views and help marketers reach their target audience with high-quality, non-intrusive ad placements. We are funded by Google Ventures, Union Square Ventures, and Genacast Ventures.
Responsibilities
  • Work with product managers, designers and developers to design and develop mobile ad formats
  • Provide technical feedback on early creative concepts
  • Be a thought leader in mobile technologies, design patterns, and implementation best practices
  • Iterate and improve existing product and engineering architecture for ad formats and A/B testing
Required Skills
  • Deep knowledge and solid experience with JavaScript, CSS and HTML
  • Experience with the latest web standards, HTML5 and CSS3
  • Experience with various, modern web frameworks and javascript libraries
  • Hands-on experience with the following technologies a plus: JQuery, Backbone.js, LESS, CoffeeScript, Bootstrap.js, Handlebars.js
  • Good understanding of programming fundamentals, software design patterns and architecture processes
  • Ability to learn quickly and find clever solutions
  • Strong work ethic, commitment and team work
What We Offer
  • Competitive compensation package, including: salary, equity and merit-based bonuses
  • An exciting, fast-paced work environment focused on results
  • Comprehensive training, support tools, and structured work model
  • Opportunity to work alongside industry leaders
  • Chance to change the mobile industry and make mobile advertising better
About Us
Yieldmo is rethinking mobile advertising to optimize yield for publishers, ROI for marketers, and the experience for consumers. We have a complete end-to-end solution, including our own ad formats, ad server, programmatic buying interface, and auction and optimization algorithms. We contract for exclusive placements on 100% of the pages of premium publishers like CNN, FOX News, CBS Local, Reuters, New York Daily News and many more. We then sell that inventory to advertisers and share the revenue with the publishers. We fill virtually 100% of the inventory and deliver higher yield than the various alternatives. We also allow for an incomparable level of testing and optimization using machine learning and predictive analysis. Google Ventures led our Series B in November, joining our Series A investors, which include Union Square Ventures and Genacast. If you're interested, please send us your resume, Linkedin profile, Github profile, and/or your website directly to will@yieldmo.com
item.excerpt:encoded: Yieldmo is looking for talented software engineers to join our growing engineering team. You'll contribute directly to our mobile advertising system that powers the busiest properties on the Internet, including CNN, Forbes, Reuters, Fox News, CBS News and more.

item.title: Ad Format Lab (Front End) Engineer
item.dc:creator: pa
item.content:encoded:
The Design Team for the Ad Format Lab is growing and we’re looking for an exceptional Engineer.
In this role, you will invent the future of advertising and commerce on the mobile web. You will collaborate with world-class Designers to research, innovate, and deliver new experiences that will run on the most heavily-visited sites on the web. You will deliver the most powerful and effective campaigns that have ever been run on the mobile internet. You will create massively scalable, yet uniquely customizable infrastructures. And you will be part of a small and closely-knit team of fun, curious, and passionate Designers & Engineers.
Our team is taking down the banner ad and closing out the pop-up ad. We’re growing a library of effective yet respectful ad formats that run on massive media sites. They’re interactive, mobile responsive, and establish a new way of thinking about distributing content on the mobile internet.

Requirements

  • To be successful as an Engineer on the Design team, you must be optimistic and generous. You are collaborative and help make others successful. You take ownership of your work, are intentional with your efforts, but unafraid of taking chances. You focus on outcomes, trust yourself, yet are prepared to ask for help when needed.
  • You know how the internet works behind the scenes.
  • You’re exceptional with Javascript, HTML5, CSS3.
  • You’ve worked with Git, Grunt, Node, and nom
  • You’re a front-end developer and lean towards full-stack Engineering.
  • You understand Data Structures and Algorithms, Programming Paradigms and Patterns, Code Quality Standards and Best Practices.
  • You’ve got experience creating visual layouts and are excited about product innovation and design methodology.

We Offer

Yieldmo offers competitive pay and stock options. Yieldmo offers health and dental benefits with paid time off. In addition to base pay, you are eligible for an annual merit-based bonus and additional stock option grant. We also have really great lunch brought in daily. About Yieldmo Yieldmo is a rapidly growing mobile advertising tech startup based near Union Square in New York City. We are backed by blue chip investors, including Time Warner, Google Ventures, and Union Square Ventures. We have built a powerful platform that is reframing advertising for mobile. We believe in effective and delightful ways to deliver advertising on mobile devices (and we don’t like interruptive advertising.) Our tech allows for unique ways to execute on this promise. Our goal is to save the world from bad mobile ads. If you're interested, please send cover letter, website/portfolio, and resume directly to will@yieldmo.com

item.title: Software Mobile Engineer — iOS
item.dc:creator: pa
item.content:encoded:
You will work closely with our product and design teams to customize the Ad experience for the mobile platform. Implement custom native user interfaces using the latest mobile programming techniques. Build reusable mobile software components for interfacing with the Yieldmo Ads platform. Analyze and optimize UI and back-end application code for efficiency and performance. We work at a fast pace and our work is generative, iterative, and we learn by doing.

Responsibilities

  • Work with a fun and enthusiastic team that has mobile first approach
  • Solve challenging problems on ever evolving mobile platform– iOS
  • Work with cross-functional teams – Product, Backend, Automation
  • Learn about new ad types and latest trends in mobile development
  • Work in Agile environment with focus on product quality and stability
  • Help in evolving our mobile strategy
  • High proficiency with development tools and workflows (modern source control systems, unit testing, continuous workflow, etc.)
  • Ability to interpret requirements to produce a design that conforms to specifications

Requirements

  • 2+ years in native iOS Development
  • 3+ years working in software development with strong object oriented principles
  • Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or similar
  • Experience interfacing with RESTful APIs
  • Good knowledge of major frameworks (Cocoa Touch, Core Services, and Core OS)
  • Understanding of recommended design patterns and architectures
  • Knowledge of iOS 8/7 features and differences from prior versions, willingness to master future versions.
  • Familiarity and understanding of Apple’s Human Interface Guidelines
  • Experience throughout the full-lifecycle of two or more mobile applications
  • Capable of managing time well and working efficiently and independently
  • Bonus: Experience with GIT
  • Bonus: Experience with Kiwi, XCTest framework.

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation including salary, equity, and merit-based Bonuses
  • Health, Dental, Vision, and other insurance plans
  • An office dog and Rancilio espresso machine and a weekly lunch gathering
  • Opportunities to connect with others at our investors’ portfolio companies
  • Macbook Pro with Retina display

About Yieldmo

Yieldmo is a rapidly growing mobile advertising tech startup based near Union Square in New York City. We are backed by blue chip investors, including Time Warner, Google Ventures, and Union Square Ventures. We have built a powerful platform that is reframing advertising for mobile. We believe in effective and delightful ways to deliver advertising on mobile devices (and we don’t like interruptive advertising.) Our tech allows for unique ways to execute on this promise. Our goal is to save the world from bad mobile ads. If you're interested, please send your app portfolio and resume to product [at] yieldmo [dot] com
item.excerpt:encoded: We are looking for an experienced, enthusiastic Mobile Engineer – iOS to participate in building mobile platform. You will become a key contributor to functionality in our SDKs that are integrated with a vast array of mobile applications. You will expand your expertise in leading-edge mobile technologies as you solve challenging problems as part of a dedicated team that takes great pride in frequent deliveries of high-quality software. This is a terrific opportunity for a seasoned iOS developer who wants to contribute to leading mobile platform.

item.title: Account Representative — Direct Response
item.dc:creator: pa
item.content:encoded:
Ideal candidates will have a strong desire to develop a career in Digital Advertising Sales. He/She will have demonstrated experience with team concepts and leadership positions. He/She will be familiar with the Internet and Mobile space and understand how mobile adoption is impacting marketplaces and companies’ business models. The Account Representative will demonstrate an ability to think creatively, sell strategically, and communicate efficiently internally and externally. He/She will have a strong desire to win, and to continually develop their personal and professional skills.

Some requirements include

  • Willingness to learn
  • Outstanding verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to manage stress well, and juggle multiple account challenges
  • Outstanding interpersonal skills
  • Demonstrated analytical ability
  • BS/BA degree recommended
  • High energy

About Yieldmo

Yieldmo is a rapidly growing mobile advertising tech startup based near Union Square in New York City. We are backed by blue chip investors, including Time Warner, Google Ventures, and Union Square Ventures. We have built a powerful platform that is reframing advertising for mobile. We believe in effective and delightful ways to deliver advertising on mobile devices (and we don’t like interruptive advertising.) Our tech allows for unique ways to execute on this promise. Our goal is to save the world from bad mobile ads. If you're interested, please email will@yieldmo.com
item.excerpt:encoded: This is an entry-level position on the Direct Response sales team with a focus on lead generation. Exceed meeting and revenue targets by working with the VP of Sales to close new business and the Account Management team to develop and foster relationships with clients.

item.title: Ad Operations Manager
item.dc:creator: dgoligorsky
item.content:encoded:
Duties & Responsibilities

  • Gather creative assets from client and agencies and provide ad copy guidance to those who need it;
  • Set-up campaign and work with 3rd party tracking vendors to confirm campaign tracking has been properly implemented. Troubleshoot any set-up or discrepancy issues.
  • Ensure that proper campaign targeting is in place by strictly following campaign trafficking and targeting documentation.
  • Verify that monthly budgets, daily campaign caps, and campaign flights are properly in place;
  • Bid advertisers to all relevant placements using the Yieldmo user interface and follow campaign bid guidance documentation provided by account management and analytics and optimization team members.
  • Launch campaigns error-free and on time.

Education/Experience

  • BA or BS degree;
  • 2-5 years of ad operations experience (agency side or advertiser operations/sales support);
  • Experience working with industry standard 3rd party ad serving (DFA, Atlas, Medialets, Conversant, Sizmek) and app-analytics providers like HasOffers, Kochava, Localitcs.
  • Excellent communication skills (written and verbal) with particular attention to detail;
  • Ability to manage multiple projects at the same time under pressure, within tight deadlines;
  • Capacity to work in a fast paced, fluid operating environment;
  • Adeptness in understanding new technologies in short periods of time;
  • Self-motivated, self-learning, and proactive in identifying all possible solutions;
  • Strong organizational skills;
  • Aptitude to troubleshoot common campaign issues.

Other Required Skills

  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, Outlook & PPT);
  • Familiarity with SQL, Photoshop, Illustrator, HTML5, JavaScript and CSS knowledge a plus.
If interested apply on our career's microsite http://www.ikrut.com/microsite/pages/Yieldmo/default.html
item.excerpt:encoded: The Ad Operations Manager at Yieldmo is responsible for working closely with the Account Management team to execute a smooth and seamless digital advertising relationship and campaign experience between Yieldmo and their advertising clients and agencies. He/she will primarily deal with launching campaigns, providing support to the Account Management team and troubleshooting technical issues during campaign set-up and launch. This person will serve as the operational point of contact on all campaigns and will work with Sales and Account Management Teams to fully service initial client needs. The ideal candidate will be a strong team player with relevant technical experience for the tasks required to execute against the operational and business goals of Yieldmo.

item.title: Contract Sourcer or Jr. Contract Recruiter
item.dc:creator: dgoligorsky
item.content:encoded:
Duties & Responsibilities

  • Manage the recruitment of sales personnel
  • Utilize knowledge of multiple recruiting sources and execute recruiting plans
  • Participate in sourcing, interviewing, and selecting candidates for open positions
  • Meet established hiring goals
  • Generate qualified candidates through cost-effective recruiting efforts such as alternative sourcing and passive candidate sourcing
  • Maintain a recruiting database for sourcing and tracking candidates

Qualifications:

  • Minimum one year of recent recruiting experience; preferably for technology positions
  • Bachelor's degree from accredited college/university or equivalent experience
  • Proficient with LinkedIn and Boolean
  • Proficient with Google Docs
If interested email your LinkedIn link + resume (.pdf please): will@yieldmo.com
item.excerpt:encoded: We're looking for a hard working, Contract Recruiter who knows how to find and connect with tough to reach candidates!

item.title: DevOps Engineer
item.dc:creator: wsparks
item.content:encoded:
Responsibilities

  • Work with a fun and enthusiastic team that has mobile first approach
  • Solve challenging problems on ever evolving mobile platform
  • Work with cross-functional teams and report to the CTO
  • Work in Agile environment with focus on product quality and stability
  • High proficiency with development tools and workflows (modern source control systems, unit testing, continuous workflow, etc.)

Requirements

  • 2+ years of production environment management
  • Scripting skills via Bash, Ruby, Pearl or other
  • Strong performance analysis and debugging skills - an expert in Shell
  • Managed a virtualized instance
  • Programming experience with strong object oriented principles
  • Experience with configuration management software
  • ETL experience

Benefits

A successful candidate will have a passion for playing with a wide variety of open source tools, be able to code and script, and enjoy building large scale services. You strive to make your teammates better by designing high performance system architectures and creating web based tools and automation to reduce operational pain. You are interested in expanding your DevOps skills to working with Big Data - we handle billions of events a day. You are not afraid of taking charge and asking the right questions especially when interacting with business stakeholders.

item.excerpt:encoded: Our startup handles billions of events a day and this person would have hands on access to our complicated data pipeline. This person would report directly to our CTO/Co-founder and work with our CFO/Co-founder. The CFO is looking for an engineer with business sense who knows how to create enterprise level BI reports and find actionable insights from our massive data set.

item.title: Publisher Operations - Account Director
item.dc:creator: wsparks
item.content:encoded:
Publisher Operations - Account Director

If you want to accelerate your career growth, you need to stop thinking about day one stuff. Instead think year one, and beyond. We’re a Google Venture backed startup that is saving the world from bad ads. Do you hate those annoying banner ads? - We do too! We’re building better mobile ads from the ground up. We’re developing a whole new ecosystem, a private marketplace where we connect Publishers to Advertisers in a transparent environment. We’re looking for a Publisher Operations - Account Director to be responsible for growing our supply-side partnerships. We have partnered with huge publishers such as CBS, FoxNews, Fortune, CNN and many more. This person will facilitate stronger relationships and conduct highly strategic and deeply operational conversations with our clients and partners. Our Publisher Operations team is focused on maximizing the value of all supply-side inventory and delivery of advertiser budgets. We pride ourselves on maintaining a high level of satisfaction among our clients. By doing this, we will change how Publishers, Advertisers and Users think about mobile ads. That’s the stuff that is beyond year one. If you are interested, here’s what year one is all about. For an Account Director, this is what it is all about - getting to work with big publishers in a startup that is making a difference.
  • Create an operating plan for key accounts to identify areas for growth, set goals to execute against that plan
  • Grow client relationships with publishers and position Yieldmo as their primary mobile revenue partner
  • Execute a metrics driven approach: analyze creative & campaign results for optimizing performance, identify new business and product opportunities, and prioritize A/B testing of publisher placements
  • Facilitate communication: lead publisher implementation kickoff calls with ad operations / engineers for both mobile web and SDK, improve the product and processes around on-boarding, and troubleshoot and escalate issues related to technical integration
  • Present quarterly business reviews and new product developments to client executive teams composed of Product, Sales and Operations.
Realistically, we need someone who has had several years of client-facing experience. We believe someone with a Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Advertising, Public Relations, Business Administration or a related field, plus one year of experience in the field will accelerate this person’s success. Most important is this person have excellent presentation and written communication skills, a strong work ethic, and professional conduct while conducting agency business. If you pull all this off you’ll unlock more revenue for our partners, and make a significant contribution towards building Yieldmo into a world-class advertising company. While this is all of the Year One and Beyond stuff, Day One is pretty good too. These are things like compensation, the company, the people, the office dog and the location. However, none of of this matters unless “year one and beyond” makes career sense for you. If interested apply on our career's microsite http://www.ikrut.com/microsite/pages/Yieldmo/default.html

item.title: Let’s talk legal stuff.
item.dc:creator: pa
item.content:encoded:
Overview

Yieldmo strives to improve the mobile advertising experience for consumers, publishers, and advertisers. Your privacy is important to us. Accordingly, we have adopted the following Privacy Policy (the “Policy”). This Policy explains how information is collected and utilized by Yieldmo, Inc. (“Yieldmo”, “we”, “us” or “our”)). This Policy applies to the Yieldmo website located at www.yieldmo.com, (the "Yieldmo Website") and to Yieldmo’s products and services, including the advertising network and platform operated by Yieldmo (the “Yieldmo Service”). Please read this Policy carefully, and feel free to contact us at privacy@yieldmo.com or at the mailing address set forth below if you have any questions regarding its content. By accessing and using the Yieldmo Website or using the various websites and applications that participate in the Yieldmo Service, you consent to us processing your information in accordance with this Policy. The Yieldmo Website and the Yieldmo Service may link to third-party websites or applications. Yieldmo does not control and is not responsible for such third-parties’ privacy practices. Users should consult the privacy policies of such third-party websites or applications to learn about such third-parties’ privacy practices. For purposes of this Policy, “Personally Identifiable Information” or “PII” means any information used or intended to be used to identify a particular individual, including name, address, telephone number, email address, financial account number, and government-issued identifier. “Non-PII” means information not included in the definition of “PII”, including information such as pages or ads visited, clicks on ads, referring domain, visit duration, device type, browser type, IP address and operating system.  

Guide to Content:

1. Use of Yieldmo Website
2. Cookies and Other Technologies
3. Yieldmo Service
4. Opt-Out of Interest-Based Advertising
5. Data Retention
6. Legal and Regulatory Compliance
7. Third-Party Service Providers
8. Business Transfers
9. Aggregate Information
10. Security
11. Information Processing and Do-Not-Track
12. Minimum Age
13. Changing Your Newsletter Subscription and Privacy Preferences
14. Changes to Privacy Policy
15. Contact


Use of Yieldmo Website

Log Data
Our servers may automatically record Non-PII from visitors to the Yieldmo Website (“Log Data”). This Log Data may be used to monitor usage, conduct administration and troubleshooting, and assist in improvements to the Yieldmo Website. We may vary and tailor the content the visitor receives in future visits to the Yieldmo Website based on such visitor’s preferences and activities as determined based upon such Log Data.  
Registration and Account Data
If you register to use the Yieldmo Website as a customer (e.g., as an advertiser, agency or publisher), we ask for and store information you provide such as your email, first name, last name, company name, username, address and phone number (collectively, “Registration Data”). After you register to use the Yieldmo Website, you may set up advertising campaigns and other account parameters. We may collect information about the manner of your use of the Yieldmo Website, including session length, IP address, time of usage, viewed pages and files, your advertising campaign selections, and other information regarding your use of the Yieldmo Website (collectively with Registration Data, the “Account Data”). This information may be used to provide the Yieldmo Service to you, conduct internal analysis, account management and maintenance, perform billing, invoicing and payment functions in connection with your account, send services-related information, alerts and promotional messages to you, and maintain and improve the performance of the Yieldmo Website and Yieldmo Service. We may also use this information to offer personalized features, including varying the content you receive in future visits to the Yieldmo Website based on your preferences and activities.  
Combination of Log Data, Registration and Account Data
Log Data may be combined with a visitor’s Registration Data and Account Data once the visitor has registered or subsequently logged into the Yieldmo Website. The combined data is used to provide, monitor and assist in improvements to the Yieldmo Website, and to customize content and advertising displayed to the user on the Yieldmo Website. Log Data, Account Data, Registration Data, and combined data is not sold or rented to third-parties. In addition, such information is not shared with third-parties except in the case of third-party service providers, legal processes and aggregate information, as noted below.


Cookies and Other Technologies

Yieldmo may collect the information noted in this Policy using the following methods:
  1. cookies, which are small data files that are stored on a visitor’s computer or device,
  2. web beacons or pixels (pieces of code used by websites or third-parties to assign online activities to a computer or browser),
  3. application software development kits, otherwise known as SDKs, which are libraries of code embedded directly in partner applications, and/or
  4. server-to-server connections with our partners.
Visitors can set their browser to reject cookies altogether, to reject Yieldmo's cookies in particular, or to delete cookies. An End User of the Yieldmo Service may opt-out of interest-based advertising from Yieldmo; please refer to the Section entitled “Opt-Out of Interest-Based Advertising” below.


Yieldmo Service

Types of Information Collected
Yieldmo partners with numerous companies to provide online advertisements to end users of mobile websites, mobile applications (“Apps) and other online media (“End Users”). As an End User browses the mobile Internet or uses Apps that include references to the Yieldmo Service, the End User’s browser or device may request advertisements from Yieldmo’s system. When Yieldmo receives these requests, and/or when Yieldmo delivers advertisements to such browser or device, we may collect Non-PII about these interactions (as well as any further interaction with the advertisements provided by the Yieldmo Service such as views, clicks, conversions, etc.). This may include, for example: IP address; unique identifiers sent to us from mobile devices, network carriers or data providers; information contained in http headers or other internet transfer protocol signals; de-identified personal information (such as email addresses or usernames that are "hashed" so as to be non-identifiable or non-linkable to an individual); anonymous demographic information such as a user's gender, age, and income range when not tied or not linkable to personal identifiers; attributes of computer or device usage, such as advertisements clicked, websites and content areas visited; date and time of advertisement request, and advertisement delivery and interaction activities; browser type and version; operating system; language setting; information about or from the presence or use of Apps on a mobile device; and location. Such information is stored on Yieldmo’s servers. We may also use the GPS location of your device if you have opted to provide it to one of Yieldmo’s publisher partners. If you have questions about how to disable your device's location services, we recommend you contact your mobile service carrier or the manufacture of your particular device. On occasion, we may also receive information from third-parties that enables advertisement optimization, independently of or in combination with the information collected by Yieldmo, such as audience interest segments and product categories. From time to time, advertisements served by Yieldmo may contain functionality that enables an End User to enter PII into such advertisements, in order to allow the End User to sign-up for or receive information regarding a product or service offered by an advertiser. In the event that an End User elects to provide PII under such circumstances, we may collect such PII on behalf of such advertiser or its agency. We may use and share such information as described under “How Information is Used” below.
How Information is Used
The information collected pursuant to this Policy may be used to provide purchasing opportunities and aggregate reports to advertisers, agencies and publishers who participate in the Yieldmo Service, to schedule, deliver and optimize advertisements, to limit the number of times a specific advertisement is presented to the same browser or device (frequency capping), to provide advertisements only to certain types of mobile devices, to anonymously track sales and conversions, to detect and eliminate fraudulent activity, to administer and enhance the Yieldmo Service, and to help Yieldmo display, optimize, target and/or customize advertisements to the interests or preferences of End Users. The PII received pursuant to this Policy may be shared solely with the applicable advertiser or its agency on behalf of whom such information was collected. The End User should review the advertiser’s privacy policy to understand how the advertiser will process such PII. Yieldmo may use such information as described in the preceding paragraph, but only after it has been anonymized so as to be non-identifiable to a particular individual. Yieldmo does not sell or rent information it collects about End Users. Yieldmo may use certain non-sensitive, general health-related information in delivering advertisements based on your perceived interest in these topics. This may include information related to general health, wellness, common ailments and illnesses, beauty and fitness, but will not include precise health information (such as a user having a certain medical condition like cancer or diabetes). For example, a user who views content related to parenting might later be shown an ad for children's clothing or accessories. Similarly, a user who views content related to fitness might later be shown ads related to exercise-related apps.


Opt-Out of Interest-Based Advertising

End Users can opt out of interest-based advertising served by Yieldmo. Click here to opt-out. In order to comply with an opt-out request, Yieldmo may set a non-unique cookie for the sole purpose of ensuring that such End User is no longer tracked individually. If an End User deletes its cookies or changes computers or devices after opting out, he or she will need to opt out again by clicking the link in this paragraph. End Users also have the option, at any time, to set their browser to not accept cookies from Yieldmo. Following an opt-out, Yieldmo's system will still provide advertisements to the End User. Please note, however, that these advertisements may be less relevant to such End User's interests.


Data Retention

PII and Non-PII are generally retained for up to 13 months, unless Yieldmo is required to retain such information for a longer period of time in order to comply with its legal or contractual obligations. After this timeframe, the information is anonymized in a way that makes it unable to be associated back to an individual computer or device and is then stored for analytical and reporting purposes. 


Legal and Regulatory Compliance

We may disclose information to fulfill legal or regulatory requirements or if we believe, in good faith, that such disclosure is legally required or necessary to protect others’ rights or to prevent harm.


Third-Party Service Providers

We retain certain third-party service providers to perform functions and services for us. We may share information with these third-party service providers, but only to the extent necessary to perform these functions and services, and only pursuant to obligations that are consistent with this Policy.


Business Transfers

We may disclose information to third-parties if: (a) we sell or buy any business or assets, in which case we may disclose your information to the prospective seller or buyer of such business or assets, or (b) if Yieldmo or substantially all of its assets are acquired by a third-party, in which case information held by Yieldmo will be one of the transferred assets. 


Aggregate Information

Yieldmo may share aggregate and anonymous usage statistics regarding the Yieldmo Service with the public or businesses with whom we work. Such aggregated information is not PII. Yieldmo may also use such aggregated information to help Yieldmo improve the design and delivery of the Yieldmo Service and increase its effectiveness.


Security

Yieldmo uses reasonable administrative, technical, personnel and physical measures to safeguard PII and Non-PII in its possession against loss, theft and unauthorized use, disclosure or modification. To that end, we have designed and deployed hardware, software, and networking solutions in an effort to reasonably secure and protect access to our systems and data. Please note that where we have given you (or where you have chosen) a password that enables you to access the Yieldmo Website or Yieldmo Service, you are responsible for keeping this password confidential. Regardless of the precautions taken by you or by us, “perfect security” does not exist on the Internet. We cannot ensure or warrant the security of any information you transmit to us, and you transmit such information at your own risk.  


Information Processing and Do-Not-Track

Your information may be kept on computers located outside of your state or country, where the privacy laws may not be as protective as those where you live. If you’re located outside the United States and choose to provide your PII to us, we may transfer your PII to the United States and process it there. Yieldmo does not currently take action in response to do-not-track signals received from Internet browsers. However, you may opt-out of having your information be used for advertisement targeting as described under " Opt-Out of Interest-Based Advertising" above.


Minimum Age

The Yieldmo Service and the Yieldmo Website are not developed for, or directed at, children under the age of 13. We do not knowingly accept registrations or information from users that are under 13. We will delete accounts of any users that we find to be under-age. If you are aware that any child under the age of 13 has become a registered user or provided personally identifiable information to Yieldmo, please inform us at privacy@yieldmo.com, so that we can confirm and take the appropriate steps to remove the account and any related information.


Changing Your Newsletter Subscription
and  Privacy Preferences

Yieldmo may send to registered users, advertisers and publishers service and/or account activity-related announcements from time to time. You can unsubscribe from our email newsletters at any time. To do so, you can follow the instructions on the bottom of each newsletter. Publisher and advertiser customers of Yieldmo may also edit their privacy preferences in their member profile or email support@yieldmo.com for such purpose. You may also write to Yieldmo Member Services at:
Yieldmo, Inc.
Attn.: Privacy
218 West 18th St., 2nd Floor
New York, NY 10011


Changes to Privacy Policy

It may be necessary from time to time for us to modify this Policy to reflect changes in the way we collect and use information or changes in privacy-related laws, regulations, and industry standards. Accordingly, we reserve the right to change this policy at any time by posting the revised policy on the Yieldmo Website. Data will be handled in accordance with the policy in effect at the time the data is used.


Contact

Please contact us with any questions or concerns at privacy@yieldmo.com or via mail at the address below:
Yieldmo, Inc.
Attn.: Privacy
218 West 18th St., 2nd Floor
New York, NY 10011
Last Updated: 3-20-15

That’s the stuff that is beyond year one.

item.title: What is Yieldmo?
item.dc:creator: pa
item.content:encoded: Yieldmo is a mobile advertising solution that increases revenue for publishers and optimizes ROI for advertisers, all while improving the overall ad-viewing experience for users. Our Ad Format Lab™ creates innovative ways to deliver advertising on mobile publisher pages, and continuously prototypes and live-tests ad formats to improve their favorability among users. Yieldmo’s Private Mobile Marketplace enables advertisers to purchase these exclusive ad experiences on the mobile pages and apps of premium publishers. The Private Mobile Marketplace is distinct in that it only includes premium advertisers and publishers, and provides transparent reporting down to the placement level.

item.title: Is Yieldmo an exchange?
item.dc:creator: pa
item.content:encoded: Yes, but not a traditional ad exchange. Yieldmo offers a private marketplace between buyers and sellers of our custom ad formats. These ad units are available through our managed service or through a real-time bidding (RTB) integration with our platform. Whether you are buying through our managed service or directly through your DSP, a strict vetting process is enforced in order to maintain the highest quality partners for both supply and demand.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: A multi-product interactive mobile ad format. Showcase your best products, drive reach, and enable action for readers on-the-go.
An interactive mobile ad format. Showcase your best products and reach quality readers on-the-go.
Campaign planning just got easier. Mock-up mobile ads in Ad Builder in just two shakes of a lamb's tail.

item.title: Account Executive: Brand
item.dc:creator: pa
item.content:encoded: Use a consultative sales approach to bring the Yieldmo platform to brands and agencies on the East Coast. Exceed revenue targets by working with the VP of Sales to close new business and the Account Management team to develop and foster key agencies and clients. The ideal Account Executive has a proven track record in Mobile Media Sales and strong contacts with agencies active in mobile advertising.
item.excerpt:encoded: Use a consultative sales approach to bring the Yieldmo platform to brands and agencies on the East Coast. Exceed revenue targets by working with the VP of Sales to close new business and the Account Management team to develop and foster key agencies and clients. The ideal Account Executive has a proven track record in Mobile Media Sales and strong contacts with agencies active in mobile advertising.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Tap into impactful ad formats and a private marketplace for publishers and advertisers to reach your audience on mobile.

item.title: How do you price your media?
item.dc:creator: fiddle
item.content:encoded: Our managed service and self-service options are priced on a CPM or CPC basis. Programmatic/real-time bidding (RTB) buyers must buy on a CPM basis. We do not offer Cost per Install (CPI) or Cost per Action (CPA) pricing.

item.title: What’s the Ad Format Lab™?
item.dc:creator: fiddle
item.content:encoded: The Ad Format Lab™ is Yieldmo’s team of designers and data scientists working to reimagine advertising on mobile. The Ad Format Lab delivers new ad formats and develops new technology to implement these concepts. The team gathers data through frequent testing in order to continuously improve and optimize Yieldmo’s unique offering.

item.title: How does your optimization engine work?
item.dc:creator: fiddle
item.content:encoded: Unlike in a traditional ad exchange, Yieldmo’s ads typically appear on 100% of a mobile publisher’s pages. Because of this consistency, we’re uniquely able to use A/B testing, machine learning, and predictive modeling to optimize our ads towards their highest possible performance level. This can include changes to the ad’s format, placement, creative, copy, and other variables. As a result, both advertisers and publishers frequently cite Yieldmo as their top-performing mobile ad partner.

item.title: How can I buy from Yieldmo?
item.dc:creator: fiddle
item.content:encoded: Advertisers can buy from Yieldmo in one of three ways. Smaller advertisers can manage campaigns themselves using our web-based product. Larger advertisers can leverage our professional services team to manage their campaigns. Lastly, programmatic buyers such as Demand-Side Platforms (DSPs) and Trading Desks can complete an RTB integration with us.

item.title: Can I third-party ad-serve?
item.dc:creator: fiddle
item.content:encoded: No, Yieldmo serves all creative on our platform. However, we allow click and impression tracking through accredited ad servers such as DFA, Atlas, and Sizmek.

item.title: Account Executive — Brand
item.dc:creator: pa
item.content:encoded:
Some responsibilities include

  • Overseeing revenue, customer development, and business opportunities in the East Coast region
  • Actively identifying and pursuing new client partnerships
  • Regularly managing development of pipeline, utilization of resources, and forecasting
  • Consistently exceeding periodic revenue goals for assigned accounts
  • Monitoring and accounting for client issues, escalating as necessary
  • Close collaboration with other teams, such as Business Development, Publisher Operations, Marketing, and Product

Some requirements include

  • At least 3-5 years of demonstrable success in mobile media sales
  • Solid ability to create profitable sales strategies
  • Experience selling mobile advertising to large brands and agencies
  • Confidence to represent company with partners, third parties, at industry events, and more
  • Exceptional presentation and communication skills
  • Strong creative and strategic thinking skills
  • Ability and willingness to accommodate moderate-heavy travel
  • BS/BA degree

About Yieldmo

Yieldmo is a rapidly growing mobile advertising tech startup based near Union Square in New York City. We are backed by blue chip investors, including Time Warner, Google Ventures, and Union Square Ventures. We have built a powerful platform that is reframing advertising for mobile. We believe in effective and delightful ways to deliver advertising on mobile devices (and we don’t like interruptive advertising.) Our tech allows for unique ways to execute on this promise. Our goal is to save the world from bad mobile ads. If you're interested email will@yieldmo.com
item.excerpt:encoded: Use a consultative sales approach to bring the Yieldmo platform to brands and agencies on the East Coast. Exceed revenue targets by working with the VP of Sales to close new business and the Account Management team to develop and foster key agencies and clients. The ideal Account Executive has a proven track record in Mobile Media Sales and strong contacts with agencies active in mobile advertising.

item.title: Where does your inventory come from?
item.dc:creator: fiddle
item.content:encoded: Premium publishers add our code to their mobile pages and apps to create new placements that are served and filled exclusively by Yieldmo. These placements typically include a high-viewability in-content placement as well as a direct response placement at the bottom of an article.

item.title: Will we know where we’re running?
item.dc:creator: fiddle
item.content:encoded: Yes, we provide full transparency to the site, section and placement where your ads run before, during and after the campaign. You can see granular impression, cost and performance data for each placement; for example, NYDailyNews – Sports Section – in-content placement.

item.title: What kind of targeting do you offer for our campaign?
item.dc:creator: fiddle
item.content:encoded: Align your campaign with content or audience by selecting the sites and sections most relevant to your campaign objectives. We also offer geo-targeting, dayparting, OS, carrier/ISP, and device targeting.

item.title: How do I start working with Yieldmo, and begin earning incremental revenue from my mobile web and in-app pages?
item.dc:creator: fiddle
item.content:encoded: Simply click here and submit your contact info, site name/URL, estimated monthly mobile pageviews and anything else you’d like us to know about your sites/apps. We will contact you within one business day!

item.title: How does the implementation process work for publishers?
item.dc:creator: fiddle
item.content:encoded: It’s incredibly simple. For mobile web implementations, all that is needed is the addition of a JavaScript snippet to your webpages. For native in-app implementations, Yieldmo has iOS and Android SDKs. We’ve had publishers launch in as quickly as one day.

item.title: Why do you require JavaScript code to be implemented on my page and your SDK in my mobile app? Can I third-party ad-serve?
item.dc:creator: fiddle
item.content:encoded: For Yieldmo’s unique ad units to render properly and for Yieldmo to optimize them effectively, we require our JavaScript on a publisher’s mobile web pages and our SDK for native in-app integration. As a result, you cannot third-party ad-serve.

item.title: Can we sell Yieldmo ad formats to our clients?
item.dc:creator: fiddle
item.content:encoded: Yes! We encourage all publishers that have sales teams to sell the Yieldmo units to their clients. We have a dedicated team of sales enablement specialists that can help with your sales training, pricing, packaging, and more. We also have specific ad formats developed by our Ad Format Lab™ that can be sold by publishers exclusively! Please contact us to learn more.

item.title: Does Yieldmo offer a reporting dashboard?
item.dc:creator: fiddle
item.content:encoded: Yes, Yieldmo provides all of our publishers with access to a real-time dashboard with detailed reporting of performance including PVs, CTR, CPC, RPM and more. Data can be viewed at the domain level, channel level, and even page-type level.

Our first month of mobile advertising data on iOS 8 reveals its early adopters are 43% more likely than their iOS 7 brethren to complete a mobile ad transaction. item.title: Holiday Season Advertising 101
item.dc:creator: M_LLinas
item.content:encoded: You may have heard about the colossal Singles' Day holiday sales that takes place in China every year. For some Chinese companies, 33% of their annual revenue can be generated from this one-day online shopping spree that puts Black Friday and Cyber Monday to shame. Last year, online spend in China exceeded $5.75 billion USD on that day alone, which was almost three times the volume seen on Cyber Monday in the United States. This year, Alibaba did $9.3 billion USD on Singles' Day —that's as much revenue as Nordstrom's US retail sales for all of 2013! Most North American retailers feel just as strongly about holiday shopping on this side of the world, with e-commerce leaders regularly stating that Q4 — and the last 6 weeks of the year in particular — can make or break their year. In fact, many of them are starting earlier than usual in 2014 to make the most of the season. Halloween, Fall Sale, Thanksgiving, Black Friday, Cyber Monday, Winter Sale, Christmas, Hanukah, New Year’s and Back-to-School. Holidays and celebrations take place throughout the year, but with so many occurring in such a short time, the sales opportunity is tremendous — and the consequences of failure can be dooming. GameStop’s stock plummeted after poor sales last year, and Best Buy had to lay off 2,000 managers to make up for a slower than expected holiday season. The best advertisers strategically prepare for each holiday shopping spree to take advantage of the wild conversion rates that naturally take place then. Your performance would improve considerably just by running your standard campaigns during this season, but why not improve it exponentially by making holiday-specific campaigns to maximize your reach and upside? Have a deal ready for each holiday and be prepared for more organic volume. Users are actively looking to spend money and they are looking for deals to reward their search efforts. A deal is usually what you offer to get a shopper’s attention, but since you already have it because of the seasonal craze, a deal becomes the way to quickly make the close. The holidays empower you to start further down the conversion funnel than any other time of year, don’t mess that up! Almost any business can take advantage of a holiday with enough creativity. Plan intelligently and imaginatively, and Santa will reward you with outsized revenues this Christmas.   Mateo Llinás is Director of Publisher Operations at Yieldmo.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The holidays empower you to start further down the conversion funnel than any other time of year, don’t mess that up!

item.title: Designing for Small
item.dc:creator: ssprockett
item.content:encoded:
I recently left a big tech company that was trying to solve big problems, the biggest problems really: poverty, urban blight, cyberterrorism, endemics, you name it. The scope of such design projects was exhilarating, but deep down I think I knew we couldn’t possibly design our way out of the big picture. There is a temptation when your brain is full of grand scales to view design as if it is some sort of alchemy, where we can turn a few experiences into one-size-fits-all gold. If you want to solve a big problem, solve it small first. Now I work at Yieldmo, an ad tech startup in an era of publishers shifting to mobile. I’ve spent the last few months with a small team trying to solve one problem: a better mobile ad. As it turns out, this dramatic narrowing of scope from global super software to humble microinteraction is changing a lot about how I think about product design.

Psychological Effect: Daemon vs. Human

Designing when you feel like the world is on your shoulders is exciting, but also frustrating and exhausting. Trying to calculate every moment of a user flow, every nuance, every external factor at such a scale is an exercise in futility. And let’s be honest, in many cases when things go off course, design teams will shrug or talk about the next release or argue about testing results. That practice doesn’t sit well with me. In the 19th Century, Pierre-Simon Laplace theorized that the future could be known by a daemon that possessed knowledge of every bit of matter and its properties. He postulated that if this daemon took a snapshot of a moment, calculated every force, every variable of everything happening and then stepped ahead to the next snapshot, it could, according to Newtonian principles of causality, calculate the next moment of the future. Unfortunately, I am no such daemon. I can only predict a handful of factors, even with lots of time to research. Inevitably, things go differently than I expect. When you’re designing at scale, this is a catastrophic phenomenon. Projects like this are often called, “slippery problems,” because the problems change more as you narrow in on them. But when you’re designing small, the outcomes of your design are more predictable. You’re designing at a depth that’s right for your human intelligence, not some daemon.

A New Way to Make Big Things

Watching The Karate Kid at 10 years-old, I was pretty annoyed that I’d signed up to watch a karate movie and I was watching some kid do chores instead. But Mr. Miyagi’s wisdom reveals itself, as Daniel is trained to turn the movements he learned in waxing cars, painting fences, and sanding floors into blocks, punches, and kicks. There is something sobering and wise about focusing on a single interaction, mastering it, and realizing its taught you how to do something bigger. At Yieldmo, we still do big things. Our ads are seen millions of times per day and our optimization engine is collecting tons of data about how people engage with them. But as designers, we stay focused on individual moments, not magnanimous systems. I think this could be a new way to design large systems. Imagine an interface that wasn’t built in one large version release, but instead was hundreds of components which all change constantly based on the context of how you behave, what the time of day is, how you perform under pressure, etc. In effect, by focusing on microinteractions (waxing on and waxing off), we’re actually winning the championship and getting the girl. It’s a lot more work to design hundreds of moments and string them together. Yieldmo is the first company of its kind to invest in a design lab like ours and we believe its the only way to do it. If we tried to make something for everyone with one blanket design, we’d inevitably alienate millions of users and contexts.

Early Lessons

There are two big areas that I’ve already learned quite a bit about from focusing on small contexts: motion and responsiveness. I’ve found that large motions work well in larger rich media formats, but subtle motions in the same size unit are often lost. In general, motion needs to be big on small screens.

Responsiveness is different at this scale too. Now, phones have higher resolutions and many tablets have higher resolutions than some desktops. All these shades of gray in device sizes has made it a necessity to design at many more breakpoints. The usual three (phone, tablet, desktop) won’t cut it anymore. At Yieldmo, we design triple the number of traditional breakpoints across a mere few inches of width change. This ensures our designs always look good.

It’s a lot more work to design small, but doing things right usually does take work. Sometimes there will be pushback about spending the effort on such a complex system of small design, but the truth is, can you afford to do it any other way? It is more costly to pursue shortcuts with one-size-fits-all solutions, than to take time and design it small.

Shawn Sprockett is a Strategic Design Lead at Yieldmo.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: If you want to solve a big problem, solve it small first.
If you want to solve a big problem, solve it small first.

item.title: Bloomberg Lists Yieldmo In Machine Intelligence Landscape Report
item.dc:creator: dgoligorsky
item.content:encoded: Many technology companies are now focused on a new kind of method for making sense of data: artificial intelligence, machine learning, deep learning, natural language processing, and others. This machine intelligence world has recently exploded and is transforming existing industries and also likely creating entirely new ones. To make sense of this world, Bloomberg Beta‘s Shivon Zilis spent the last 3 months researching more than 2,500 startups and created a Machine Intelligence Landscape. She found that enterprises, industries and humans are all being augmented by machine intelligence. Big companies will have a disproportionate advantage since they have the massive datasets and user interactions, but Shivon sees the technology they develop rapidly spilling into other areas, particularly as startups take the core technologies being developed into niche use cases. View The Full Article

item.title: The Honest Company and Yieldmo Partner to Reach "Moms on the Go"
item.dc:creator: dgoligorsky
item.content:encoded:
Yieldmo helped Honest acquire new customers at superior click-to-conversion rates, outperforming other mobile ad partners by 5X.

Goal

Drive New Customer Acquisition for Honest’s Products

Honest is an eco-friendly personal care & home cleaning products retailer, co-founded by Jessica Alba in 2012. Mobile advertising has played a consistent role in Honest’s customer acquisition strategy, as busy moms frequently use mobile devices. “Our target audience is moms on the go,” said Rachel Kwan, Online Marketing Manager at Honest. “They’re multitasking on their phones and tablets, or checking their phones while out running errands. Mobile works great for us.”
“Performance was amazing. It’s great to see how the campaign has continued to scale, while still hitting all our backend metrics." -Rachel Kwan, Online Marketing Manager
Despite mobile advertising’s potential, Honest has had mixed experiences working with mobile ad partners. “We dabbled with a few mobile ad networks, and it was a very frustrating experience,” said Kwan. “The cost per lead would come in close to our goal. But the quality of the buyers don’t back out, which is ultimately what counts.”  

Strategy

Use Yieldmo’s Exclusive, Premium Placements on Top Mobile Publishers to Engage Potential Customers

Yieldmo delivered Honest’s message across relevant, premium mobile sites, including BabyCenter and Parents. “Inventory quality is important, especially on mobile. Publisher quality is what is going to make or break a campaign,” Kwan said. Honest’s marketing team also valued Yieldmo’s transparency. “With ad networks, it’s more of a black box. With Yieldmo, it’s great to have visibility into which publishers your ads are running on and how they’re performing,” Kwan said. Honest ran a combination of in-content and footer units, driving potential customers to visit its website, sign up for a free trial, and ultimately purchase Honest products. The Yieldmo account team continuously optimized Honest’s creative, down to the placement level. “For the best campaigns, it’s not just about the media, it’s also about the team helping execute them,” Kwan said.  

Results

Yieldmo Delivered High-Quality Customers to Honest at Click-to-Conversion Rates 5X Those of Other Mobile Partners

From the campaign’s inception, Yieldmo delivered high-quality leads to Honest. Yieldmo’s click-to-conversion rates were 5X those of other mobile partners in the campaign’s first month. Furthermore, the cost-per-buyer Yieldmo delivered was consistently lower than that of other mobile providers. Based on the strength of early performance metrics, Honest has steadily shifted budget to Yieldmo. “Performance was amazing” Kwan said. “It’s great to see how the campaign has continued to grow, from a scale perspective, while still hitting all our backend metrics.” In fact, Honest has increased its monthly spend with Yieldmo by more than 57% in the past two months. Honest plans to deepen its relationship with Yieldmo, expanding campaigns to international publishers and testing new proprietary ad formats. Download the Case Study

item.title: AlleyWatch Ranks Yieldmo's Founder Among NYC Startup Founders to Watch For in 2015
item.dc:creator: dgoligorsky
item.content:encoded:
Michael Yavonditte

Yieldmo, CEO Yieldmo is saving the world from bad mobile ads, and hats off to Michael Yavonditte for that. Yieldmo’s Ad Format Lab has invented dozens of proprietary formats that drive better results and command higher prices – without ruining the viewer experience. Think of it as Disney Imagineers meets ad format creation. And since tools like AdSense aren’t exactly porting effectively to mobile advertising, well, that explains why Google Ventures participated in Yieldmo’s $10M Series C round back in October. Along with Time Warner Ventures, Union Square Ventures and Genacast. “Yavo” was previously CEO of Quigo, which was acquired by AOL for $361M. The company currently has several patents pending. Yup, keep an eye on this one! View the Full Article
